lessons.name: Propositional Arguments - Find Conclusion
lessons.description: Propositional Arguments - Find Conclusion will test if you can find the conclusion in a propositional argument.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: You wouldn't be frivolous if you were either cheap or not scholarly.| As a consequence,
you must be scholarly| - since clearly
you're frivolous.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: George isn't both a carpenter and also either strong or frightened.
George must be a carpenter,| since obviously
George isn't strong.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: A necessary and sufficient condition for Donna being both cruel and realistic is that Donna isn't boastful.| Thus
Donna isn't cruel.| My evidence for this is that
Donna is boastful.| And obviously
Donna isn't realistic.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: It is sufficient that you be a dentist, in order for you to be short and remarkable.
You aren't short.| It follows that
you can't be a dentist.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: These two facts prove to us that |Jim is poor.| First,
Jim isn't both poor and not faithful.| Second,
Jim is faithful.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Harry can't be clean| - due to these facts.
Assuming that Harry is clean, then it can't be that Harry is both scholarly and not frivolous.| Also,
Harry is scholarly.| Finally,
Harry isn't frivolous.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: A necessary and sufficient condition for Donna being both short and gentle is that Donna isn't cheerful.| Thus
Donna isn't short.| My evidence for this is that
Donna is cheerful.| And obviously
Donna isn't gentle.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Provided that you're a lifeguard, then if you're rich then you're cowardly.
You're a lifeguard.| This means that
you aren't rich| - inasmuch as
you aren't cowardly.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: On the assumption that Jim is a convict, Jim would be rough but fanatical.| This proves that
Jim isn't rough,| because
Jim isn't a convict.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: We know that |Alex isn't both bright and also not greedy.| We also know that
Alex isn't greedy.| Putting these facts together, we conclude that
Alex isn't bright.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: These two facts prove to us that |Harry isn't a criminal.| First,
Harry isn't both a criminal and also either slow or fortunate.| Second,
Harry is slow.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Donna is clean.| I say this because of the following facts.
Being a foreigner is necessary in order for Donna to be clean.| And
Donna is a foreigner.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Alex is poetic, provided that Alex is both dull and likeable.| Now
Alex is likeable.| I conclude that
Alex isn't dull| - since of course
Alex isn't poetic.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Harry can't be rich| - due to these facts.
Assuming that Harry is rich, then it can't be that Harry is both dangerous and not sarcastic.| Also,
Harry isn't dangerous.| Finally,
Harry isn't sarcastic.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Jim must be careful.| This is true because of the following reasons. First,
Jim is careful if Jim is both rough and sociable.| Second,
Jim is rough.| Finally,
Jim is sociable.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: On the assumption that P is a bachelor, P would be strong but careful.| This proves that
P isn't strong,| because
P isn't a bachelor.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Provided that you're a carpenter, then if you're dull then you're frightened.
You're a carpenter.| This means that
you aren't frightened| - inasmuch as
you aren't dull.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: You aren't poor, unless you aren't boastful.
You're poor.| We may infer that
you aren't boastful.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Keith is bright.| I say this because of the following facts.
Being a dentist is necessary in order for Keith to be bright.| And
Keith is a dentist.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: You wouldn't be bitter if you were either slow or not famous.| As a consequence,
you must be famous| - since clearly
you're bitter.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: I've concluded that
you're a student.| Here are my reasons.
If you aren't a student, then you aren't either cheap or greedy.| And
you aren't cheap.| But
you're greedy.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: A necessary and sufficient condition for Donna being both clean and fortunate is that Donna isn't selfish.| Thus
Donna isn't clean.| My evidence for this is that
Donna is selfish.| And obviously
Donna isn't fortunate.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Provided that you're a cannibal, then if you're dull then you're loveable.
You're a cannibal.| This means that
you aren't dull| - inasmuch as
you aren't loveable.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Sally must be poor.| This is true because of the following reasons. First,
Sally is logical if Sally is both poor and comical.| Second,
Sally is logical| Finally,
Sally is comical.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Jim can't be rough| -- due to these facts.
Assuming that Jim is rough, then it can't be that Jim is both poetic and not dangerous.| Also,
Jim isn't poetic.| Finally,
Jim isn't dangerous.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Donna is slow or a customer, only if Donna is bashful but romantic.
Donna must be bashful,| since obviously
Donna is slow.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Provided that it's true that if you're a clown then you're strong, then you're boring but not frivolous.| Of course
you're frivolous.| These are my reasons for saying that
you aren't strong.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: You can't be generous.
If you were a librarian, then you'd be clean or generous.| Naturally
you aren't clean.| Similarly,
you aren't a librarian.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: You're cruel and boastful, only if you're also remarkable.
You aren't remarkable.| Consequently
you aren't boastful.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Harry isn't both a pessimist and also either dull or creative.
Harry must be a pessimist,| since obviously
Harry isn't dull.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: You're both a scientist and poor, unless you're famous but bitter.| This implies that
you're bitter.| I assume that
you aren't a scientist.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Joseph is greedy, provided that Joseph is both rich and confused.| Now
Joseph is confused.| I conclude that
Joseph isn't rich - since of course
Joseph isn't greedy.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: A necessary and sufficient condition for Keith being both cheap and brilliant is that Keith isn't frantic.| Thus
Keith isn't cheap.| My evidence for this is that
Keith is frantic.| And
obviously Keith is brilliant.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: You aren't a doctor.
If you were a doctor, then you'd be cruel or gloomy.| Naturally
you aren't cruel.| Similarly,
you aren't gloomy.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: These two facts prove to us that|* Harry isn't a democrat.| First,
Harry isn't both a democrat and also either short or logical.| Second,
Harry is short.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: You wouldn't be romantic if you were poor but not dangerous.| This is my reason for saying that
you're dangerous| - since of course
you're romantic.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Perry is sarcastic, provided that Perry is both bold and curious.| Now
Perry is curious.| I conclude that
Perry isn't sarcastic| - since of course
Perry isn't bold.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: Derek is a convict.| I say this because of the following facts.
Being a convict is necessary in order for Derek to be rough.| And
Derek is rough.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: We know that |Harry isn't both smart and also not frightened.| We also know that
Harry isn't frightened.| Putting these facts together, we conclude that
Harry isn't smart.

staticQuestions.question: Please find the conclusion in this argument.

answers.answer: You must be slow|, for these reasons.
You're a criminal just if you aren't slow.| And
you aren't a criminal.
